function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Transmission of contagious diseases in the built environment due to open floor plans and lack of privacy","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for adaptive furnishing in open-plan layouts","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Risk of noise transmission in open-plan layouts","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate spatial organization leading to congestion and limited separation between activities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficient modular system leading to inadequate adaptation of spaces for multiple functions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for acoustic factors leading to noise interference between spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The use of movable walls and adjustable open plans may increase the risk of airborne disease transmission within the home.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shared living spaces increase the risk of contagious disease transmission, especially during an epidemic.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on automation and smart home technology may lead to increased sedentary behavior and decreased physical activity, impacting overall health and immunity.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of aeroponic systems for food production within the living environment may introduce new health risks and potential contamination.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased reliance on home automation and smart homes may lead to a higher risk of exposure to contagious diseases within the household.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Flourishing information and communication technology ict , internet of things iot , and artificial intelligence ai in smart homes may create vulnerabilities for cyber-attacks and data breaches, posing a risk to personal and healthcare information security.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased sales and adoption of iot devices and smart home systems may result in environmental impacts from electronic waste and energy consumption.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of smart home devices for health monitoring can lead to privacy concerns and data security risks.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to electromagnetic waves from 5g technology may have potential health risks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive study of smart home technologies and their social implications may result in unforeseen societal challenges.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased time spent cooking and eating at home leading to potential transmission of contagious diseases in the kitchen","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fomite transmission of covid-19 through contaminated surfaces in households","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survival of the coronavirus on various household surfaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Coronavirus settling for a longer time period on surfaces at lower temperatures and in conditions of low and high relative humidity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 lasting for several days on certain materials such as plastics, ceramics, silicone rubber, glass, and stainless steel","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trends against antimicrobial additives may lead to reduced use of effective materials that can prevent the spread of viruses on surfaces.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased reliance on antimicrobial additives in building materials","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Promotion of laxity in hygienic practices due to false sense of security from antimicrobial materials","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential movement of antimicrobial materials into the natural environment and sewage system","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of contagion in residential shared facilities kitchens, dining rooms, etc. due to challenges with social distancing","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased pressure on electricity and water resources due to remote work and distance education","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption in unoccupied public buildings during lockdown","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in controlling the consumption of natural resources in epidemic-resilient homes","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of energy independence during complete lockdown","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient energy consumption in unoccupied buildings during lockdown","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper disposal and treatment of wastewater from people infected with covid-19 affecting water, soil, environment, and living organisms","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of coronavirus genetic material in wastewater with increasing prevalence of covid-19 infection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fecal-oral transmission of infectious diseases through wastewater","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increasing consumption of fresh water in residential buildings during quarantine","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Improper treatment of sewage contaminated with the virus leading to contamination of fresh water sources","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of chlorine in drinking water during distribution as an additional precaution","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emergence of new viral infectious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of diseases from animal species to humans","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of infectious diseases via indoor air","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate housing conditions for low-and middle-income people","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socio-economic gap in housing levels","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor distribution of housing units","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sustainable architectural and urban design","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate housing environment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Economic gap and housing costs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate housing conditions contributing to the spread of contagious diseases, including covid-19, due to lack of safety and healthy environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adequate quarantine facilities and isolation spaces within housing environments, leading to uncontrolled transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to address the housing needs of marginalized groups, leading to increased vulnerability to contagious diseases and public health disparities.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in population density due to movement toward urban areas","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"}]}
